title.en: Middle and Late Iron Age on the Territory of Baltic States

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Topic of this course is Middle (450-800 AD) and Late Iron Age (800-beginning of 13th century) on the territory of Baltic countries. Archaeological sites and items are introduced, processes occured in technology, economy and society during this period are outlined.
description.et: Kursuse teemaks on keskmine (450-800 pKr) ja noorem rauaaeg  (800-13. sajandi algus) Baltimaade alal. Tutvustatakse sellest perioodist säilinud muistiseid ja muinasesemeid ning antakse ülevaade vaadeldaval ajastul tehnoloogias, majanduses ning ühiskonnakorralduses aset leidnud protsessidest.

objectives.en: The students will be given an overview of the sources for studying Estonian Middle Iron Age (450-800 AD) and Late Iron Age (800-1250). Comparison with cultures of contemporary Northern Europe cultures in both their material and non-material aspects will be provided.
objectives.et: Anda teadmised, millised allikad on olemas Eesti keskmise (450-800 pKr) ja noorema rauaaja (800-1250) kohta ja kuidas Eesti ala aineline ja vaimne kultuur suhtestub tollase Põhja-Euroopa kultuuriruumiga.

learning_outcomes.en: After successfully passing the course, the student will
-be acquainted with the main sources for studying the period (types of archaeological sites, most significant sites, relevant methods of natural sciences, material culture);
learning_outcomes.et: -teab vaadeldava perioodi põhilisi allikaid (muistiseliigid, olulisemad muistised, loodusteaduslikud allikad, esemeline kultuur);

learning_outcomes.en: -know prevalent interpretations of those sources provided in Estonian archaeology up to now.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

name.en: Centre for Archaeological Research and Infrastructure
